document_title: Lupus glomerulonephritis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: viem-cau-than-lupus.json_4_Risk of complications of Lupus nephritis
subsection_content:
Dialysis patients at the Department of Artificial Nephrology - Urology and Nephrology Center - Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City
The most serious complication of lupus nephritis is permanent kidney damage, which reduces kidney function, causing chronic kidney disease or kidney failure. At this time, to maintain kidney function, the patient may need dialysis or a kidney transplant. (3)
Dialysis process at the Center for Urology and Nephrology - Tam Anh General Hospital in Ho Chi Minh City is equipped with a new generation dialysis machine, which automatically checks the quality of the filter after each dialysis session, without needing to take the patient's blood for testing. , limiting blood loss and reducing costs for patients.
Although lupus nephritis is a dangerous disease, in most cases, the disease will not develop into kidney failure if the patient follows the doctor's instructions.
